title: The number that shows Google's search engine slowing down at a worrying rate
text:
Google's search engine growth is slowing down at an alarming rate, the internet giant has revealed.

Financial results released by Google's parent company Alphabet showed that paid clicks on its search engine - a crucial measure of growth - had grown by just 18pc year-on-year in the third quarter of the year. A year ago, growth in paid clicks was 62pc.

It comes after decades of tremendous growth, suggesting that users are increasingly reticent to click on adverts while using Google to browse the web. Jim Cridlin, analyst at WPP Mindshare said: “As more and more searches are executed via mobile and voice devices, Google has fewer opportunities to sell paid search results. This puts downward pressure...
description: Google's search engine growth is slowing down at an alarming rate, the internet giant has revealed.
